{"comments": {"id": 427, "count": 95, "talk_id": 511}, "threadId": 427, "requested_language_english_name": "English", "current_talk": "511", "description": "In this funny (and actually poignant) 3-minute talk, social strategist Renny Gleeson breaks down our always-on social world -- where the experience we're having right now is less interesting than what we'll tweet about it later.", "event": "TED2009", "language": "en", "language_swap": false, "name": "Renny Gleeson: Our antisocial phone tricks", "slug": "renny_gleeson_on_antisocial_phone_tricks", "series_slug": null, "speakers": [{"id": "431", "slug": "renny_gleeson", "is_published": true, "firstname": "Renny", "lastname": "Gleeson", "middleinitial": "", "title": "", "description": "Skeptimist", "photo_url": "https://pe.tedcdn.com/images/ted/82611_254x191.jpg", "whatotherssay": "", "whotheyare": "Renny Gleeson helps navigate brands through fresh concepts, such as viral marketing and social media, to find the pulse of the modern consumer. ", "whylisten": "

Renny Gleeson is a skeptical/optimist. He leads interactive strategy for ad agency Wieden+Kennedy who started his career as a game developer. He has been wondering what we can learn about ourselves through the millions of deaths taking place inside video games. He serves on the board of directors of Rhizome.org and is the co-founder of the PIE tech accelerator in Portland, Oregon. A mentor for tech accelerators and startups worldwide, he believes stories -- from cave paintings to interfaces to video games -- shape worlds.

"whotheyare": "Renny Gleeson helps navigate brands through fresh concepts, such as viral marketing and social media, to find the pulse of the modern consumer. ", "whylisten": "

Renny Gleeson is a skeptical/optimist. He leads interactive strategy for ad agency Wieden+Kennedy who started his career as a game developer. He has been wondering what we can learn about ourselves through the millions of deaths taking place inside video games. He serves on the board of directors of Rhizome.org and is the co-founder of the PIE tech accelerator in Portland, Oregon. A mentor for tech accelerators and startups worldwide, he believes stories -- from cave paintings to interfaces to video games -- shape worlds.
